body:
> Is this a newly introduced bug due to the latest change?

quite sure it is.

rules like this
```php
            [['unitId'], 'exist',
                'skipOnError' => true,
                'targetClass' => DurationUnit::className(),
                'targetAttribute' => ['unitId' => DurationUnit::tableName() . '.id'],
                'filter' => function (DurationUnitQuery $query) {
                    $query->active();
                }
            ],
```
produced error now :rage: :anger: :fire: :fire_engine: 
```SQL
SELECT EXISTS(SELECT * FROM `duration_unit` WHERE (`duration_unit`.[[`duration_unit`.id]]=1) AND (`duration_unit`.`stateOfFlags`=1))'
```
:smile_cat:

Can create "error on exists validator after c6ab3f8" :1st_place_medal: 


So... Tell about usages `getTablesUsedInFrom` - how many places we need changes?
Ohh... the case for manual prefixing wasn't taken into account :(

https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/validators/ExistValidator.php#L226
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/validators/UniqueValidator.php#L179
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/validators/UniqueValidator.php#L299

I think need function named like `applyPrefix($column, $prefix = null)` for this case
Yes. Something like that. I'm temporary busy. If you want to work on it in few next days, feel free to do so.

issue.title: Apply primary table alias; include case manual set alias

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | yes

body:
So... Ordinary unique validator has some error without alias :smile_cat: 
```php
            [['unitId', 'value'], 'unique', 'targetAttribute' => ['unitId', 'value']],
```
```mysql
SELECT EXISTS(SELECT * FROM `duration` WHERE (`duration`.[[{unitId}]]=1) AND (`duration`.[[{value}]]=1))'
```

Pls, tell me about "{" and "}" around the table column name.

without this brackets still work:
```
{{%duration}}.[[unitId]]
{{%duration}}.[[value]]
```

Works.  The select for the exists validation is now correct:


    SELECT EXISTS(SELECT * FROM `submission_call` WHERE (`submission_call`.`id`=12))

issue.title: Apply child table alias/name for joinWith case to condition columns

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
One step to resolve the problem with ambigous column name and apply alias.

As part of #7263:

For case `joinWith` functional: only one child table inside `joinWithRelation` for each time
i.e. not allowed 
```SQL
SELECT * FROM
a JOIN b,c 
WHERE a.id = b.a_id and b.id = c.b_id
```
i.e. ActiveQuery for the child table is have single `from` and can be use single prefix.

Note:
for #14161
This method can be private or 
`framework/validators/ExistValidator.php`
`framework/validators/UniqueValidator.php`
can use this method too

Example: after path
```php
class Duration extends \yii\db\ActiveRecord {
...
    public function getUnit()
    {
        return $this->hasOne(DurationUnit::className(), ['id' => 'unitId'])->inverseOf('durations');
    }
...
}
```
```php
        echo Duration::find()
            ->joinWith([
                'unit as unitAlias' => function (DurationUnitQuery $query) {
                    $query->andWhere(['id' => [5, 3, 2, 1]]);
                }
            ])
            ->andWhere(['id' => [4, 5, 9]])
            ->alias('durationAlias')
            ->createCommand()->getRawSql();
```
produce
```SQL
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`unitAlias`.`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))
```
current 
```SQL
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))
```

and "as target" result must be
```SQL
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`durationAlias`.`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`unitAlias`.`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))
```
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | yes
| Breaks BC?    | yes/no
| Tests pass?   | yes/no
| Fixed issues  | #7263, #14166, #14161, #14150

issue.title: Apply child table alias/name for joinWith case to condition columns (with test)

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
One step to resolve the problem with ambigous column name and apply alias.

As part of #7263:

For case `joinWith` functional: only one child table inside `joinWithRelation` for each time
i.e. not allowed 
```SQL
SELECT * FROM
a JOIN b,c 
WHERE a.id = b.a_id and b.id = c.b_id
```
i.e. ActiveQuery for the child table is have single `from` and can be use single prefix.

Note:
for #14161
This method can be private or 
`framework/validators/ExistValidator.php`
`framework/validators/UniqueValidator.php`
can use this method too

Example: after path
```php
class Duration extends \yii\db\ActiveRecord {
...
    public function getUnit()
    {
        return $this->hasOne(DurationUnit::className(), ['id' => 'unitId'])->inverseOf('durations');
    }
...
}
```
```php
        echo Duration::find()
            ->joinWith([
                'unit as unitAlias' => function (DurationUnitQuery $query) {
                    $query->andWhere(['id' => [5, 3, 2, 1]]);
                }
            ])
            ->andWhere(['id' => [4, 5, 9]])
            ->alias('durationAlias')
            ->createCommand()->getRawSql();
```

```SQL
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`unitAlias`.`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))
```
current 
```SQL
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))
```

and "as target" result must be
```SQL
SELECT `durationAlias`.* FROM `duration` `durationAlias` LEFT JOIN `duration_unit` `unitAlias` ON `durationAlias`.`unitId` = `unitAlias`.`id` WHERE (`durationAlias`.`id` IN (4, 5, 9)) AND (`unitAlias`.`id` IN (5, 3, 2, 1))
```

include some tests
